availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Hickman Walker (Crittenden County, Kentucky, merchant, private (C.S.A.))

body.p: Crittenden County, Kentucky, merchant, private (C.S.A.) Native of Crittenden County, Kentucky. Son of Robert Alexander Walker and Nellie Hickman Walker. Married to Hortense Gregory Walker in Crittenden County, Kentucky on February 5, 1856. Farmer in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1850. Merchant in Crittenden County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the Third Kentucky Mounted Infantry (C.S.A.) from August 1861 to April 1864. Deserted C.S.A on April 8, 1864. Captured as Confederate prisoner of war in Hopkins County, Kentucky on April 15, 1864. Signed Oath of Allegiance to United States in Hopkins County, Kentucky on April 15, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 212A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Crittenden, District 1, p. 503.
Find A Grave, "James Hickman Walker (1827-1906)," Memorial #54394924, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/54394924 (accessed April 19, 2019).
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Crittenden County Marriages, Film 000558428, p. 129.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0095.
